result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel M. Wiersig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff Department.  The costs are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning April 1, 2017.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff Department.

The jail sentence may be served with huber. The jail sentence shall begin immediately.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

Defendant Daniel M. Wiersig in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Daniel M. Wiersig in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest to count 1 - possession of drug paraphernalia and count 5 bail jumping.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 and 5.  Court dismisses and read in counts 2, 3 and 4.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Nocco.  Court orders in count 1 - court costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  Count 5  - court orders 60 days county jail with huber concurrent to any other sentence; court costs and DNA sample.  Court orders 45 days sentence credit.   Court orders April 1, 2017 - $25.00 a month for payment on court costs.  - rt

Arrest Report

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $2,000.00 signature bond and a $500.00 cash bond with conditions of: booking; no contact with J.Z & B.K.; not to possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.  DE makes a  statement. Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for April 26, 2016 at 1:00 p.m. - ba
